result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin R Mech

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on November 13, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Justin R Mech in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case is dismissed and read-in for defendant's plea to Case #14CF425, 14CF426, 14CM691, 14CM693.  Calendar call scheduled for November 13, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant to have no contact with any alleged victim, Alexandra B. or her residence and family listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program within 1 business day of being released from custody for the purposes of submitting to random urine screens.  MODIFIED CONDITION:  Defendant allowed huber bailee status. Defendant MUST find employment within 1 WEEK.

Defendant Justin R Mech in court, in custody, with Attorney Mark E. Kershek.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek requests bail modification.  State objects to any bail modification.  Court will modify bail to include huber bailee status.  Previous court date set remains on.
Motion hearing on August 11, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's motion for reduction of bail filed by Attorney Kershek.
WC inmate communication form received today, requesting huber bailee status or a bail hearing. Copied to Atty Kershek.

Prior: 515 West Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States
Hearing on October 16, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Mark E. Kershek in court.   Defendant Justin R Mech did not appear.  Court waives Defendant's appearance.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Christine Bohn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court adjourns.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for October 16, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on July 18, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Justin R Mech in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Legal Intern for attorney Mark E Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests this matter be continued to Branch 4 with defendant's other cases. Preliminary Hearing time limits tolled.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on July 2, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Prior: 1360 Valley Ridge Dr., Brookfield, WI 53005
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant to have no contact with any alleged victim, Alexandra B. or her residence and family listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program within 1 business day of being released from custody for the purposes of submitting to random urine screens.

Defendant Justin R Mech in court, in custody, with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has not been evaluated by the Public Defender's Office, but has other cases that have been appointed Attorney Mark Kershek by the State.  Preliminary  Hearing time limits tolled.  Hearing scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
